Token.Abstract: The service configuration used to instantiate this service client.
The service configuration used to instantiate this service client.
The service configuration used to instantiate this service client.

The MQTT configuration used by this service client. Any changes to this configuration object will take effect upon the next invocation of either the connectWithClientId or connectUsingWebSocketWithClientId methods.

The MQTT configuration used by this service client. Any changes to this configuration object will take effect upon the next invocation of either the connectWithClientId or connectUsingWebSocketWithClientId methods.

The MQTT configuration used by this service client. Any changes to this configuration object will take effect upon the next invocation of either the connectWithClientId or connectUsingWebSocketWithClientId methods.

Returns the singleton service client. If the singleton object does not exist, the SDK instantiates the default service client with defaultServiceConfiguration from [AWSServiceManager defaultServiceManager]. The reference to this object is maintained by the SDK, and you do not need to retain it manually.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The default service client.

Token.Abstract: Creates a service client with the given service configuration and registers it for the key.

Parameter.Name: configuration
Parameter.Abstract: A service configuration object.

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: A string to identify the service client.

Token.Abstract: Creates a service client with the given service configuration and AWSIoTMQTTConfiguration and registers it for the key.

Parameter.Name: configuration
Parameter.Abstract: A service configuration object.

Parameter.Name: mqttConfig
Parameter.Abstract: A AWSIoTMQTTConfiguration object.

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: A string to identify the service client.

Token.Abstract: Retrieves the service client associated with the key. You need to call + registerIoTDataManagerWithConfiguration:forKey: before invoking this method.

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: A string to identify the service client.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An instance of the service client.

Token.Abstract: Removes the service client associated with the key and release it.

Parameter.Name: key
Parameter.Abstract: A string to identify the service client.

Token.Abstract: Enable or disable sending SDK name and version in the Mqtt Connect message. Enabled by default. Must be called before calling connect.
Initialises the MQTT session and connects to AWS IoT using certificate-based mutual authentication

Parameter.Name: clientId
Parameter.Abstract: The Client Identifier identifies the Client to the Server.

Parameter.Name: cleanSession
Parameter.Abstract: specifies if the server should discard previous session information.

Parameter.Name: certificateId
Parameter.Abstract: contains the ID of the certificate to use in the connection; must be in the keychain

Parameter.Name: callback
Parameter.Abstract: When new mqtt session status is received callback will be called with new connection status.

ReturnValue.Abstract: true if initialise finished with success

Token.Abstract: Initialises the MQTT session and connects to AWS IoT using WebSocket/SigV4 authentication. IAM credentials are taken from the current service configuration.

Parameter.Name: clientId
Parameter.Abstract: The Client Identifier identifies the Client to the Server.

Parameter.Name: cleanSession
Parameter.Abstract: specifies if the server should discard previous session information.

Parameter.Name: callback
Parameter.Abstract: When new mqtt session status is received the callback will be called with new connection status.

ReturnValue.Abstract: true if initialise finished with success

Token.Abstract: Disconnect from a mqtt client (close current mqtt session)
Get the current connection status

ReturnValue.Abstract: AWSIoTMQTTStatus

Token.Abstract: Send MQTT message to specified topic

Parameter.Name: string
Parameter.Abstract: The message (As NSString object) to be sent.

Parameter.Name: topic
Parameter.Abstract: The topic for publish to.

Parameter.Name: qos
Parameter.Abstract: The QoS value to use when publishing (optional, default AWSIoTMQTTQoSAtMostOnce).

ReturnValue.Abstract: Boolean value indicating success or failure.

Token.Abstract: Send MQTT message to specified topic

Parameter.Name: string
Parameter.Abstract: The message (As NSString object) to be sent.

Parameter.Name: topic
Parameter.Abstract: The topic for publish to.

Parameter.Name: qos
Parameter.Abstract: The QoS value to use when publishing (optional, default AWSIoTMQTTQoSAtMostOnce).

Parameter.Name: ackCallback
Parameter.Abstract: the callback for ack if QoS > 0.

ReturnValue.Abstract: Boolean value indicating success or failure.

Token.Abstract: Send MQTT message to specified topic

Parameter.Name: data
Parameter.Abstract: The message (As NSData) to be sent.

Parameter.Name: topic
Parameter.Abstract: The topic for publish to.

Parameter.Name: qos
Parameter.Abstract: The QoS value to use when publishing (optional, default AWSIoTMQTTQoSAtMostOnce).

ReturnValue.Abstract: Boolean value indicating success or failure.

Token.Abstract: Send MQTT message to specified topic

Parameter.Name: data
Parameter.Abstract: The message (As NSData) to be sent.

Parameter.Name: topic
Parameter.Abstract: The topic for publish to.

Parameter.Name: qos
Parameter.Abstract: The QoS value to use when publishing (optional, default AWSIoTMQTTQoSAtMostOnce).

Parameter.Name: ackCallback
Parameter.Abstract: the callback for ack if QoS > 0.

ReturnValue.Abstract: Boolean value indicating success or failure.

Token.Abstract: Subscribes to a topic at a specific QoS level

Parameter.Name: topic
Parameter.Abstract: The Topic to subscribe to.

Parameter.Name: qos
Parameter.Abstract: Specifies the QoS Level of the subscription: AWSIoTMQTTQoSAtMostOnce or AWSIoTMQTTQoSAtLeastOnce

Parameter.Name: callback
Parameter.Abstract: Reference to AWSIOTMQTTNewMessageBlock. When new message is received the callback will be invoked.

ReturnValue.Abstract: Boolean value indicating success or failure.

Token.Abstract: Subscribes to a topic at a specific QoS level

Parameter.Name: topic
Parameter.Abstract: The Topic to subscribe to.

Parameter.Name: qos
Parameter.Abstract: Specifies the QoS Level of the subscription: AWSIoTMQTTQoSAtMostOnce or AWSIoTMQTTQoSAtLeastOnce

Parameter.Name: callback
Parameter.Abstract: Reference to AWSIOTMQTTNewMessageBlock. When new message is received the callback will be invoked.

ReturnValue.Abstract: Boolean value indicating success or failure.

Token.Abstract: Subscribes to a topic at a specific QoS level

Parameter.Name: topic
Parameter.Abstract: The Topic to subscribe to.

Parameter.Name: qos
Parameter.Abstract: Specifies the QoS Level of the subscription: AWSIoTMQTTQoSAtMostOnce or AWSIoTMQTTQoSAtLeastOnce

Parameter.Name: callback
Parameter.Abstract: Reference to AWSIOTMQTTExtendedNewMessageBlock. When new message is received the callback will be invoked.

ReturnValue.Abstract: Boolean value indicating success or failure.

Token.Abstract: Subscribes to a topic at a specific QoS level

Parameter.Name: topic
Parameter.Abstract: The Topic to subscribe to.

Parameter.Name: qos
Parameter.Abstract: Specifies the QoS Level of the subscription: AWSIoTMQTTQoSAtMostOnce or AWSIoTMQTTQoSAtLeastOnce

Parameter.Name: callback
Parameter.Abstract: Reference to AWSIOTMQTTExtendedNewMessageBlock. When new message is received the callback will be invoked.

Parameter.Name: ackCallback
Parameter.Abstract: the callback for ack if QoS > 0.

ReturnValue.Abstract: Boolean value indicating success or failure.

Token.Abstract: Unsubscribes from a topic

Parameter.Name: topic
Parameter.Abstract: The Topic to unsubscribe from.

Token.Abstract: Register for updates on a device shadow
Token.Declaration: - (BOOL)registerWithShadow:(NSString *)name options:(NSDictionary<NSString*,NSNumber*> *_Nullable)options eventCallback:(void ( ^ ) ( NSString *name , AWSIoTShadowOperationType operation , AWSIoTShadowOperationStatusType status , NSString *clientToken , NSData *payload ))callback

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The device shadow to register for updates on.

Parameter.Name: options
Parameter.Abstract:
A dictionary with device shadow registration options. The options are:
enableDebugging: BOOL, set to YES to enable additional console debugging (default NO) enableVersioning: BOOL, set to NO to disable versioning (default YES) enableForeignStateUpdateNotifications: BOOL, set to YES to enable foreign state updates (default NO) enableStaleDiscards: BOOL, set to NO to disable discarding stale updates (default YES) enableIgnoreDeltas: BOOL, set to YES to disable delta updates (default NO) QoS: AWSIoTMQTTQoS (default AWSIoTMQTTQoSMessageDeliveryAttemptedAtMostOnce) shadowOperationTimeoutSeconds: double, device shadow operation timeout (default 10.0)

Parameter.Name: callback
Parameter.Abstract: The function to call when updates are received for the device shadow.

ReturnValue.Abstract: Boolean value indicating success or failure.

Token.Abstract: Unregister from updates on a device shadow

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The device shadow to unregister from updates on.

ReturnValue.Abstract: Boolean value indicating success or failure.

Token.Abstract: Update a device shadow

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The device shadow to update.

Parameter.Name: jsonString
Parameter.Abstract: The JSON string to update the device shadow with.

ReturnValue.Abstract: Boolean value indicating success or failure.

Token.Abstract: Update a device shadow with json data and client token. If the json data is not valid, it returns false, and no update message will be published. If the json data is valid, it publishes the data on $aws/things/thingName/shadow/update topic, then return true.

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the device shadow to be updated

Parameter.Name: jsonString
Parameter.Abstract: The shadow state in format of JSON string

Parameter.Name: clientToken
Parameter.Abstract: The client id to use when upadating the shadow

ReturnValue.Abstract: True if json string is valid and can be serialized successfully; False if it cannot be serialized successfully.

Token.Abstract: Get a device shadow

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The device shadow to get.

ReturnValue.Abstract: Boolean value indicating success or failure.

Token.Abstract: Get a device shadow

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The device shadow to get.

Parameter.Name: clientToken
Parameter.Abstract: A client token to use when requesting the device shadow.

ReturnValue.Abstract: Boolean value indicating success or failure.

Token.Abstract: Delete a device shadow

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The device shadow to delete.

ReturnValue.Abstract: Boolean value indicating success or failure.

Token.Abstract: Delete a device shadow

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The device shadow to delete.

Parameter.Name: clientToken
Parameter.Abstract: A client token to use when deleting the device shadow.

ReturnValue.Abstract: Boolean value indicating success or failure.
